columns.description: The internal unique GIS identifier of the drinking fountain.

columns.description: Indicates whether a drinking fountain is activated during the Cool IT! NYC 2020 program (between approximately July to October 2020)

columns.description: Indicates the unique type of a drinking fountain per Parks specifications

columns.description: The count of drinking fountain fixtures

columns.description: Indicates whether a drinking fountain is painted

columns.description: Indicates specific location details within a Parks property

columns.name: OMPPropID
columns.description: Unique identification number for a property or portion of a property. In some cases – a standalone, smaller park for example – this number will be equivalent to the GIS Property Number. In other cases – a zone, playground or other site within a larger park – an additional designation of letters and/or numbers will be added.

columns.name: SubPropertyName
columns.description: The name of the subproperty (Zone or Playground) that the drinking fountain falls within

columns.description: Unique status code that identifies drinking fountain status within Parks asset management system

columns.description: Unique Parks asset management system location ID that identifies Parks property, subproperty, or structure within which a drinking fountain is located

fields.name: Agency

view.description:
This dataset represents amenities activated as a part of Cool It! NYC, a Citywide plan to increase the amount of cooling features available to the public during heat emergencies, particularly in neighborhoods that face the dangers of high heat. This is part of the Cool It! NYC 2020 Data Collection, which includes the following amenities:

Drinking Fountains: Indicates whether a drinking fountain is activated, not yet activated, broken, or under construction.

Spray Showers: Indicates whether a spray shower installed before July 2020 is activated, not yet activated, broken, or under construction. At this time, spray showers are mapped to the middle of parks.

Cooling Sites: To measure neighborhoods that are the most at risk during extreme heat, NYC Health and Columbia University developed the New York City Heat Vulnerability Index, or HVI. Parks used this data to direct new cooling elements to neighborhoods with HVIs of 4 and 5.

Data Dictionary: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GpXHX9p0e520LcAf3gstOKTQm64wxkdDUiACjhMwd9Q/edit?usp=sharing
view.emailShareUrl: mailto:?subject=Cool It! NYC 2020 - Drinking Fountains&body=Here is a dataset from NYC Open Data that I would like to share with you: https%3A%2F%2Fdata.cityofnewyork.us%2Fdataset%2FCool-It-NYC-2020-Drinking-Fountains%2Fwxhr-qbhz

coreView.description:
This dataset represents amenities activated as a part of Cool It! NYC, a Citywide plan to increase the amount of cooling features available to the public during heat emergencies, particularly in neighborhoods that face the dangers of high heat. This is part of the Cool It! NYC 2020 Data Collection, which includes the following amenities:
  
Drinking Fountains: Indicates whether a drinking fountain is activated, not yet activated, broken, or under construction. 

Spray Showers: Indicates whether a spray shower installed before July 2020 is activated, not yet activated, broken, or under construction. At this time, spray showers are mapped to the middle of parks. 
 
Cooling Sites: To measure neighborhoods that are the most at risk during extreme heat, NYC Health and Columbia University developed the New York City Heat Vulnerability Index, or HVI. Parks used this data to direct new cooling elements to neighborhoods with HVIs of 4 and 5.
 
Data Dictionary: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GpXHX9p0e520LcAf3gstOKTQm64wxkdDUiACjhMwd9Q/edit?usp=sharing
